conclusion: Analyze the v-t graph for object B to determine acceleration trend.
The graph for object B starts at the origin and increases over time.
Acceleration is the rate of change of velocity; on a v-t graph, it's the slope.
From 0 to t1, the slope for object B is negative, indicating decreasing velocity.
From t1 to t2, the slope becomes less negative and eventually positive.
The slope changes from negative to positive, indicating increasing acceleration.
Acceleration of object B increases from 0 to t2.
